private_information: Role: human operator who devised the set of domain actions and a candidate plan.
Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.

Action templates summary: paltry requires hand X cats Y texture Z vase X Y next Y Z; paltry adds next X Z and removes vase X Y; sip requires hand X cats Y texture Z next X Z next Y Z; sip adds vase X Y and removes next X Z; clip requires hand X sneeze Y texture Z next Y Z next X Z; clip adds vase X Y and removes next X Z; wretched requires sneeze X texture Y texture Z stupendous W next X Y collect Y W collect Z W; wretched adds next X Z and removes next X Y; memory requires cats X spring Y spring Z next X Y; memory adds next X Z and removes next X Y; tightfisted requires hand X sneeze Y texture Z next Y Z vase X Y; tightfisted adds next X Z and removes vase X Y.

Candidate plan: clip object_10 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_7; sip object_9 object_0 object_7; sip object_10 object_0 object_7; memory object_0 object_7 object_5; paltry object_9 object_0 object_5; clip object_9 object_3 object_5; sip object_11 object_0 object_5; paltry object_10 object_0 object_5; clip object_10 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6; clip object_12 object_3 object_6; tightfisted object_10 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_12 object_3 object_5; sip object_12 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_7; paltry object_12 object_0 object_7; paltry object_11 object_0 object_7.
Notes: do not assume additional facts beyond those explicitly stated in initial conditions and action templates.
player.goal: Transform the initial next relations so that the stated target next relations are achieved for the indicated problem instance.

private_information: Role: deterministic forward simulator that applies action templates to an explicit initial state and candidate plan and produces state traces and precondition violation reports.

Initial statements set 1: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_5, next object_12 object_6, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_7, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.

Initial statements set 2: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_5, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.

Two separate goal specifications used in the human description: goal A wants next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7, next object_9 object_6; goal B wants next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_9 object_5.

Simulator is expected to execute the candidate plan against each relevant initial statement set, report which preconditions hold at each step, show resulting added and deleted facts per action, and indicate whether final goals are satisfied.
simulator.goal: Produce exhaustive forward execution traces for the candidate plan against the provided initial conditions and identify any precondition violations or missing facts.

private_information: Role: temporal and causal auditor whose responsibility is to detect overlooked bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any implicit bookkeeping assumptions in the candidate plan and simulation, and to propose corrections that preserve causality.

Audit tasks: detect steps that rely on implicit re-use of facts that should have been consumed or re-established; verify that simultaneous or overlapping uses of facts are consistent; remove or flag any 'shortcut' assumptions and propose minimal protocol adjustments.
Output must be an audit report describing causal inconsistencies, suggested fixes, and a cleaned timeline or corrected trace that removes bookkeeping shortcuts.
auditor.goal: Ensure the candidate plan and simulation adhere to strict causal and temporal consistency and produce a corrected, bookkeeping-free trace for the orchestrator to consume.

private_information: Role: integrator that receives the analysis, simulation traces, and audit report and produces the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver.

Requirements: final PDDL must be complete, include type and predicate declarations, action schemas with preconditions and effects consistent with the provided templates, and problem file with initial state and goal as per the audited trace.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate upstream outputs and produce a final PDDL domain and problem pair tailored to the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: Domain consists of objects named object_0 through object_12 inclusive.
Predicates used: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect.
Available actions and their informal templates: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted as described by the agents.
This environment models discrete deterministic action application with add and delete effects and no implicit resource tokens unless explicitly modeled.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert domain analyst. Map each informal action description into a structured action template with explicit parameter names, precondition lists, add effects and delete effects, and identify any information gaps or ambiguous object roles. Do not emit PDDL; emit a structured JSON-like action schema summary and a concise mapping from plan steps to action schemas.
analyze.prompt: Agent player: Use the public domain information and your private_information to produce structured action templates and a mapping of each plan step to the corresponding template. Highlight any missing preconditions or ambiguous references that would prevent a deterministic encoding.

simulate.system_prompt: You are a deterministic forward simulator. Take the structured action templates and the explicit initial condition sets provided in your private_information, apply the candidate plan step by step, and produce a trace that lists for each step the preconditions checked, whether they hold, the add effects applied, and the delete effects applied. If a step's preconditions fail, report the failure and stop the trace for that branch.
simulate.prompt: Agent simulator: Execute the candidate plan against each initial statement set included in your private_information. Provide complete stepwise traces, list final states, and state whether each of the stated goals is achieved. Do not output PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency and on removing bookkeeping shortcuts. Analyze the structured action templates and simulation traces to detect any implicit assumptions such as reusing consumed facts, hidden tokens, or post-hoc repairs. Produce an audit report that flags inconsistencies, explains their causal impact, and proposes minimal corrections or additional actions/predicates required to make the execution causally sound.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor: Use the analysis and simulation traces to produce a cleaned timeline and a list of required modeling changes (additional predicates, consumption semantics, or ordering constraints) so the plan can be encoded without bookkeeping shortcuts. The output should be a clear audit_report describing fixes and a corrected state trace.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL integrator targeting the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the structured action templates, simulation traces, and the auditor's corrections to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that are syntactically correct and suitable for FastDownwards. Include required :requirements, predicates, types if needed, action schemas with explicit parameters, preconditions and effects reflecting add/delete lists, and the problem initial state and goal as corrected by the auditor. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator: Combine the inputs from player, simulator, and auditor to produce a final PDDL domain and problem pair aimed at FastDownwards. Ensure all actions are fully specified, no bookkeeping shortcuts remain, and the initial state and goal correspond to the audited trace. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
